physics

Class Physics

  • java.lang.Object
    • physics.Physics

  • public class Physics
extends java.lang.Object
    Methods to calculate planet coordinates, and ship coordinates, momentum, and collisions.
    Author:
    Joshua Fan

      • shipFlight

        public static void shipFlight(Ship ship,
                              Celestial sun,
                              Planet[] planets)
        Calculates ship momentum and coordinates while on planet and in flight.

        On planet: Coordinates are relative to planet, offset by the radius of the planet in relation to the angle of the ship.

        Build guideline and pass current coordinates to history.

        Parameters:
        ship -
        sun -
        planets -

      • shipGuideline

        public static void shipGuideline(Ship ship,
                                 Celestial sun,
                                 Planet[] planets)
        Calculates the ship guideline's next coordinates and momentum. Calculations for the future accommodate the future positions of planets. Recurses until guideline is full.

        Momentum is an accumulation of previous momentum and all forces on the ship. Coordinates are previous coordinates + momentum.

        Parameters:
        ship -
        sun -
        planets -

      • detectCollision

        public static boolean detectCollision(Celestial celestial,
                                      Ship ship)
        Detects collision between a celestial object and a ship by checking the distance between the edges of 2 circles.
        Parameters:
        celestial -
        ship -
        Returns:
        boolean
